Circular No.  04/2008 
 
Sub: Technical Specification of Security Tamper-Evident Bags 
(STEBs)  for carriage of Liquids, Aerosols and Gels (LAGs).  
 
 
1. 
GENERAL : 
 
1.1 
LAGs, in any volume, purchased at airport retail outlets during the 
day(s) of the journey shall be carried in STEB’s as per the following 
procedure.  
 
2.  
Technical specifications for STEBs ; 
 
2.1 
Material to be used 
 
- transparent (high impact low density polyethylene(LDPE) or 
equivalent); 
- recyclable and environment-friendly products if possible; and  
- size and thickness (minimum of 50 microns) to be adjusted to the 
needs. 
 
2.2 
On the top face of the STEB: 
 
2.2.1 Closure : 
 
- red tamper evident tape (minimum 30 mm tape with 40 mm release 
liner); 
- high tack pressure sensitive self adhesive; and  
- integral security device/hidden graphic to show if tampered with. 
 
2.2.2 Border:

- side and bottom weld be no less than 15 mm width in red; and  
- printed border of minimum 5 mm with “Do not open” , airport name, 
or any other continuous message of design which may bleed over the 
edge of the bag. (Optional-Integral security device/hidden graphic to 
show if borders are tampered with.)  
2.2.3 Message: 
 
- “BCAS” (font size equal to ICAO name) shall  be printed in light 
blue colour at the top right corner; 
- security sign (provided by ICAO Aviation Security and Facilitation 
(S&F) Branch) in green in the middle of the security box; and  
- box in red at bottom stating “Do not open until final destination. 
Contents may be confiscated if bag is tampered with”.  
 
2.2.4 Confirmation / identification features: 
 
- Receipt space (or jacket, optional) inside the bag visible in the top left 
of the security box; and 
- The receipt shall contain the following information:  
o  Date of purchase (dd/mm/yyyy); 
o  Place of purchase (state, airport, airline) using international 
codes; 
o  Flight number (s) and name of passenger; and 
o  Number and list of items purchased and placed in the STEB. 
 
2.2.5 Origin of the bag: 
 
- State three-letter code (Machine readable travel document) to 
determine the State of origin where the STEB was provided to the 
passenger; 
- Manufacturer name; and 
- Inventory code and security code or device to protect STEB at 
retailers and shops.  
 
2.3   On the back face of the bag: 
 
- Individual airport/retailer/other branding or logos.   
 
2.4   Size of the STEB:
3:

- 25 cm X 15 cm or 20.5 cm x 20.5 cm.  
 
3. 
Operational Considerations 
 
3.1  
Receipts should be inside the STEB, face visible from outside, and 
securely placed in the left top of the security box (either with a jacket 
inside the bag, or fixed accordingly). If the receipt has moved and is 
not visible for security screening purposes, the bag will have to be 
opened and its contents may be confiscated (or placed in a new STEB 
by security staff at the security screening point).  
 
3.2   Manufacturer codes are placed by the manufacturers. Inventory and 
security codes are the responsibility of the retailers. STEBs should be 
distributed to authentic parties only.  
 
4. 
Known Supplier of LAGs and/or Known Supplier of STEBs shall 
ensure implementation of the security controls and protection from 
unauthorised interference with supplies of LAGs or supplies of 
STEBs, respectively, from their first point of entry on airside until 
their delivery to passengers. The Known Supplier of LAGs and/or the 
Known Supplier of STEBs fully accepts responsibility, by written 
declaration, for the implementation and quality control of LAGs and 
STEBs within the supply chain on the airside.  
 
5. 
Known suppliers of LAGs/STEBs shall be approved by the 
Commissioner 
of 
Security 
(Civil 
Aviation). 
STEB 
manufacturer/Distributor shall register them with ICAO prior to 
approval by Commissioner of Security (CA). Distributors of STEBs 
may become known supplier of STEBs provided they take full 
responsibility of the security chain mentioned herein above. 
 
6.  
These Regulations shall come in to force with immediate effect from   
1st August, 08. 
 
(M. Malaviya) 
Addl.Commissioner of Security (CA) 
 
 
Distribution as per list attached.

Corrigendum to Circular No.  15/2006 
 
 
Sub: Procedures for carriage of Duty Free items by departing passengers on 
board the aircraft at airports in India. 
 
 
With reference to BCAS Circular mentioned above, the following 
corrections may be made : 
 
Para no. 1 (vi)  may be substituted with the words   “ the Duty Free 
Shop will hand over the duty free items to passengers concerned in the 
Security Tamper Evident Bags (STEBs) specified by BCAS.” 
 
 
 
Note : This exemption to apply for duty –free shops located inside the SHA 
only. For outside, it shall be gate-delivered.
